intro: Chamaemelum pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Chamaemelum pinnatifidum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
